reporting-org.narrative: INPUD International Network of People who Use Drugs

title.narrative: Bridging the Gaps: Nepal - Addressing Human rights, Advocacy, Access to Reproductive and Sexual Health Services.

description.narrative: BtG aims to facilitate community development by: 1. Building of national PWUD network; Facilitating community development on advocacy. 2. Advocating for the continuous strengthening of services and upholding human rights.3. Using evidence from the Human Rights Count (HRC) report on PWUD living with HIV (BtG 1) to build an advocacy campaign, and push for legislative and programmatic changes to ensure that the health and human rights needs of PLHIV drug users are advanced. 4. Deliver inclusive, rights-based and gender sensitive services 5. Implementing an efficient and high-quality Needle and Syringe Programme in Kathmandu Valley. 6. Conducting size estimation of IDU’s in Kathmandu Valley and conducting effective outreach; 7. Training outreach workers on thematic skills and pilot outreach methods in the field. 8. Foster global and in-country processes and partnerships that reinforce results. 9. Improving partnerships in-country with other NGOs, government, the Health Council, and organisations that can assist in (data) management systems.

In Nepal, prejudice and discriminatory attitudes towards key populations hinder access to health services, especially those seeking STI and antiretroviral treatment, or need other drug services than rehabilitation. People who use drugs face punitive legal environments and human rights abuses, are socially marginalised and experience discriminatory attitudes when they try to access medical care, find employment or simply get by. Women who use drugs are a hidden population, often victims of domestic abuse and police violence. Harm reduction services have been introduced almost two decades ago, but they are still funded from international sources and the whole sector is marked by the instability of funding, making achievements look rather frail.

sector.narrative: Increased fulfillment of human rights of key populations and strengthened civil society that holds government to account.

description.narrative: 2A # of service providers trained. This is the number of individual service providers meaning staff members, trained by alliance partner and/or by a country partner. Total # is the number of people trained by alliance partner and number of people trained by partners. Service providers provide social (including psychosocial support, health education and promotion, online counselling, NOT the counselling part of VCT services), or health(NGO or public sector) services. They are individuals within local partner organisations within BtG that provide services, as well as from indirect service providers that receive training from BtG local partners (e.g. other NGO-run clinics, private clinics, state-run services, etc).

2A # of service providers trained. This is the number of individual service providers meaning staff members, trained by alliance partner and/or by a country partner. Total # is the number of people trained by alliance partner and number of people trained by partners. Service providers provide social (including psychosocial support, health education and promotion, online counselling, NOT the counselling part of VCT services), or health(NGO or public sector) services. They are individuals within local partner organisations within BtG that provide services, as well as from indirect service providers that receive training from BtG local partners (e.g. other NGO-run clinics, private clinics, state-run services, etc).

comment.narrative: Bridging the Gaps uses two age groups since 2017 reporting onwards: 24 and under, and 25 and above, as agreed with MOFA. For the sex work project, the youngest age group will be 18-24 years.

title.narrative: 5 # human rights violation cases acted on

description.narrative: 5 # human rights violation cases acted on. This is the number of violations documented and in the process of being acted on, instead of ‘responded to’, meaning that the cases are taken further than documentation, for example reporting, providing psychosocial and or paralegal or legal support.

title.narrative: 4 Participation of partner organization in or organization of local national regional or global stakeholder meetings

description.narrative: Participation of partner organization in or organization of local national regional or global stakeholder meetings is measured by the number of partner organisations that participate in meetings. Meetings are defined as advocacy meetings with local national regional or global stakeholders.
